details.alternative_title: Loan for students over 24 years old
details.overview: If you’re aged 24 or older, you'll be able to apply for a loan to help cover tuition fees for courses starting on or after 1 August 2013

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
If you’re aged 24 or older, you can apply for a loan to help cover tuition fees for courses starting on or after 1 August 2013.

You won’t have to pay anything back until you’re earning over £21,000 a year.

Applications open from April 2013.

parts.title: What you'll get
parts.body:
The amount you’ll get depends on:

  • the type of course you take
  • how much the fees are

The minimum loan you can get is £300.

You don’t have to borrow the full cost of your course - you can pay for some of it yourself.

How the loan is paid

The money will be paid directly to your college or training organisation once they’ve confirmed you’ve attended the course for 2 weeks.

parts.title: Eligibility
parts.body:
To get a loan you must be:

  • 24 or older on the first day of your course (there’s no upper age limit)
  • living in the UK on the first day of your course, and have lived in the UK, the Channel islands or the Isle of Man for 3 years immediately before this
  • starting your course on or after 1 August 2013
  • taking an eligible course that’s level 3 or above (such as A levels or a higher or advanced apprenticeship)
  • studying at a college or training organisation in England approved for public funding

Getting a loan doesn’t depend on your household income and there’s no credit check.

parts.title: How to claim
parts.body: You’ll be able to apply online or by post from April 2013 for courses starting between 1 August 2013 and 31 July 2014.

parts.title: Further information
parts.body:
Ask your college or training organisation for more details.

Paying back your loan

You don’t have to pay back your loan (plus interest) until you’ve finished your course and start earning more than £21,000 a year.

You can get independent financial advice from the Money Advice Service.

Applying for another loan

You can apply for more 24+ Advanced Learning Loans after you finish your course (4 in total), but:

  • you can only get 1 loan at a time
  • you can’t apply for another loan to repeat the same level of a course (eg you can’t get a loan to fund a Level 3 certificate in French when you have previously had a loan to fund a Level 3 certificate in Italian)

Access to Higher Education (HE)

If you get a loan to cover tuition fees for an Access to HE course (eg a course that will prepare you for higher education) and then complete a higher education course, you won’t have to repay the remaining loan for the access course.
